# St. James Episcopal Church (Fort Edward, New York)

| locmapin     = New York#USA
| built        = 1846
| architect    =
| architecture = Gothic Revival
| added        = January 7, 1998
| area         = less than one acre
| refnum       = 97001617
}}
St. James Bible Fellowship, formerly St. James Episcopal Church, is a historic church at 112 Broadway in Fort Edward in Washington County, New York.  It was built in 1849 and modified in three stages in 1880, 1896, and 1914â€“1915.  It is a Gothic Revival style ecclesiastical structure and features a side bell tower on the northwest corner of the building.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1998.
